intro: Gilia stenothyrsa, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. The leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant characteristics.
